description: A breakfast joint makes two different sandwiches: a regular and a special. Both need eggs and bacon. Each regular sandwich requires 2 eggs and 3 slices of bacon. Each special sandwich requires 3 eggs and 5 slices of bacon. The joint has a total of 40 eggs and 70 slices of bacon. It makes a profit of $3 per regular sandwich and a profit of $4 per special sandwich. How many of each sandwich should be made to maximize profit?

objective.description: "The goal is to maximize the total profit from producing regular and special sandwiches"

constraints.description: 2 * (number of regular sandwiches) + 3 * (number of special sandwiches) <= 40 (eggs available)
3 * (number of regular sandwiches) + 5 * (number of special sandwiches) <= 70 (bacon slices available)
number of regular sandwiches and number of special sandwiches are nonnegative integers (non-negativity and integrality)

numSandwiches.definition: Number of sandwiches produced for each sandwich type (regular, special)
